# Gurdwara Guptsar Sahib

| functional_status     = Always open
| image                 = Gurudwara Guptsar Sahib, Chhattiana.jpg

| caption               = Gurudwara Guptsar Sahib, a view from the new Sarovar

Guptsar Sahib () is a holy Gurdwara (English: Sikh shrine) located on the outskirts of Chhattiana village of Sri Muktsar Sahib district in Punjab, India.
History
The tenth Sikh guru, Guru Gobind Singh, visited the place after the Battle of Muktsar in 1705.
Peer Sayyad Ibrahim
There was a Muslim saint who was a recluse, named Ibrahim, who received the name Ajmer Singh () when the tenth master came to this village. The shrine of the Pir/Peer is located at  near the Gurudwara in northwest direction.
